oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from C. J. Morris to Dr. Jabez P. Cannon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: C. J. Morris, 50th Tenn. Inf., CSA, and later secretary for the "National Reunion of the Blue and Gray" in Evansville, Ind., wrote to Dr. J. P. Cannon of McKenzie, Tenn. about arrangements for attending veterans for the Oct. 1899 event. President McKinley; was to attend, as were 400 ex-Confederates from Nashville. J. P. Cannon served as a sergeant in Co. C, 27th Ala. Inf., CSA. After the war, he was a druggist and published "Inside of Rebeldom: The Daily Life of a Private in the Confederate Army" in 1900.
